title: Banana Peanut Butter Cheesecake aka "The Elvis"
ingredients: 3 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, at room temperature
instructions: 1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8-inch cake pan and line the bottom with waxed paper. 2. Combine graham cracker crumbs, 3 tablespoons sugar, melted butter, and 3/4 teaspoon banana extract until mixture holds together; press into the bottom of the cake pan. 3. Bake in the oven for about 8 minutes; set aside to cool. 4. In a double boiler, melt peanut butter chips and half-and-half until smooth; set aside to cool. 5. With a stand mixer, beat cream cheese until smooth; gradually add 1/2 cup sugar. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Beat in mashed bananas, lemon juice, remaining banana extract, and vanilla extract. Add the peanut butter mixture and mix until smooth. 6. Pour filling into cooled crust. 7. Place the cheesecake pan in a larger baking pan; fill the larger pan with hot water to bake in a water bath. 8. Bake for about 1 hour until set. Turn off the oven and cool the cheesecake inside for 1 hour. 9. Run a knife around the edges, flip the pan onto a wire rack, and slowly remove the pan. Refrigerate for 8 hours before serving.
